title: Metro server crashes
body:
# Problem

The Metro server is crashing after 1-2 seconds after the server is started.

```log
➜  status-mobile ✗ make run-metro  
Configuring Nix shell for target 'clojure'...
No changes detected.
Done in: 1.159s
yarn run v1.22.19
$ react-native start
warn Package react-native-blob-util contains invalid configuration: "dependency.hooks" is not allowed. Please verify it's properly linked using "react-native config" command and contact the package maintainers about this.
warn Package react-native-navigation contains invalid configuration: "dependency.assets" is not allowed,"dependency.hooks" is not allowed. Please verify it's properly linked using "react-native config" command and contact the package maintainers about this.
                                                      
                        #######                       
                   ################                   
                #########     #########               
            #########             ##########          
        #########        ######        #########      
       ##########################################     
      #####      #####################       #####    
      #####          ##############          #####    
      #####    ###       ######       ###    #####    
      #####    #######            #######    #####    
      #####    ###########    ###########    #####    
      #####    ##########################    #####    
      #####    ##########################    #####    
      #####      ######################     ######    
       ######        #############        #######     
         #########        ####       #########        
              #########          #########            
                  ######### #########                 
                       #########                      
                                                      
                                                      
                    Welcome to Metro!
              Fast - Scalable - Integrated



To reload the app press "r"
To open developer menu press "d"

jest-haste-map: Watchman crawl failed. Retrying once with node crawler.
  Usually this happens when watchman isn't running. Create an empty `.watchmanconfig` file in your project's root folder or initialize a git or hg repository in your project.
  Error: Watchman error: A non-recoverable condition has triggered.  Watchman needs your help!
The triggering condition was at timestamp=1687286390: opendir(/Users/javid/Projects/status-mobile/node_modules/metro-core/node_modules/jest-regex-util/build) -> Too many open files
All requests will continue to fail with this message until you resolve
the underlying problem.  You will find more information on fixing this at
https://facebook.github.io/watchman/docs/troubleshooting.html#poison-opendir. Make sure watchman is running for this project. See https://facebook.github.io/watchman/docs/troubleshooting.
node:events:491
      throw er; // Unhandled 'error' event
      ^

Error: A non-recoverable condition has triggered.  Watchman needs your help!
The triggering condition was at timestamp=1687286390: opendir(/Users/javid/Projects/status-mobile/node_modules/metro-core/node_modules/jest-regex-util/build) -> Too many open files
All requests will continue to fail with this message until you resolve
the underlying problem.  You will find more information on fixing this at
https://facebook.github.io/watchman/docs/troubleshooting.html#poison-opendir

    at ChildProcess.<anonymous> (/Users/javid/Projects/status-mobile/node_modules/fb-watchman/index.js:207:21)
    at ChildProcess.emit (node:events:513:28)
    at maybeClose (node:internal/child_process:1091:16)
    at ChildProcess._handle.onexit (node:internal/child_process:302:5)
Emitted 'error' event on WatchmanWatcher instance at:
    at Client.<anonymous> (/Users/javid/Projects/status-mobile/node_modules/metro/node_modules/jest-haste-map/build/watchers/WatchmanWatcher.js:150:10)
    at Client.emit (node:events:513:28)
    at ChildProcess.<anonymous> (/Users/javid/Projects/status-mobile/node_modules/fb-watchman/index.js:214:12)
    at ChildProcess.emit (node:events:513:28)
    at maybeClose (node:internal/child_process:1091:16)
    at ChildProcess._handle.onexit (node:internal/child_process:302:5) {
  watchmanResponse: {
    version: '2023.01.30.00',
    error: 'A non-recoverable condition has triggered.  Watchman needs your help!\n' +
      'The triggering condition was at timestamp=1687286390: opendir(/Users/javid/Projects/status-mobile/node_modules/metro-core/node_modules/jest-regex-util/build) -> Too many open files\n' +
      'All requests will continue to fail with this message until you resolve\n' +
      'the underlying problem.  You will find more information on fixing this at\n' +
      'https://facebook.github.io/watchman/docs/troubleshooting.html#poison-opendir\n'
  }
}

Node.js v18.16.0
error Command failed with exit code 1.
info Visit https://yarnpkg.com/en/docs/cli/run for documentation about this command.
make: *** [run-metro] Error 1
```


#### Expected behaviour

The Metro server should work as expected without any errors.


### Additional Information

- Operating System: macOS 13.4
- Xcode version: `v14.3.1`
- Node: `v18.16.0`

The error says `Too many open files`. I tried killing the server with the `watchman shutdown-server` command in the Nix shell (targeting watchman) and restarted the system. No luck. I keep getting the error. Nix is on the latest version (`2.14.1`) and on the latest commit of `develop`.

I'm getting this error after the Nix changes are merged. It was working well before that.

cc @yakimant @jakubgs 
Is it probably related to the very recent `nodejs` bump from `nixpkgs` upgrade? : https://github.com/status-im/status-mobile/commit/c97559793cd8af8d09ba38fc68f9f5b51545eb9c  
not sure because this doesn't happen for me locally

Couldn't reproduce locally on macOS.
@smohamedjavid, can you post the following:
```
sysctl kern.maxfiles
sysctl kern.maxfilesperproc
ulimit -n
```

@siddarthkay, did you check locally on Linux? Can you try on macOS too?

@smohamedjavid, please also post
```
lsof | wc -l
lsof -n | cut -f1 -d' ' | uniq -c | sort | tail -30
```
before/after `make run-metro`

@yakimant : 
output from my mac : 
```log
siddarthkumar@Siddarths-MacBook-Pro status-mobile % sysctl kern.maxfiles
kern.maxfiles: 184320
siddarthkumar@Siddarths-MacBook-Pro status-mobile % sysctl kern.maxfilesperproc
kern.maxfilesperproc: 92160
siddarthkumar@Siddarths-MacBook-Pro status-mobile % ulimit -n
256
```

output from my linux : 
```log
siddarth@siddarth-ROG-Strix-GA35DX-G35DX:~/code/status-mobile$ sysctl kern.maxfiles
sysctl: cannot stat /proc/sys/kern/maxfiles: No such file or directory
siddarth@siddarth-ROG-Strix-GA35DX-G35DX:~/code/status-mobile$ sysctl kern.maxfilesperproc
sysctl: cannot stat /proc/sys/kern/maxfilesperproc: No such file or directory
siddarth@siddarth-ROG-Strix-GA35DX-G35DX:~/code/status-mobile$ ulimit -n
1024
```

no crash for me while running metro on both linux , macOS.. maybe its a rosetta thing?

@yakimant : before running metro for me on MacOs: 
```log
siddarthkumar@Siddarths-MacBook-Pro status-mobile % lsof | wc -l
   86529
siddarthkumar@Siddarths-MacBook-Pro status-mobile % lsof -n | cut -f1 -d' ' | uniq -c | sort | tail -30

1114 SpringBoa

Wow, `node_modules` is 71292 files and 11336 folders.
Is it wort adding it or some of it's subfolders to `ignore_dirs` in `.watchmanconfig`?

@siddarthkay it's possible I guess. But I cannot reproduce it locally. Works fine for me.

I guess @smohamedjavid could try to `git revert --no-commit c9755979` and see if that fixes it for him.
Same error happening for me
I experience same problem at the moment
Same issue here

`ulimit -n` says I have 7000 files limit.

Tried:
- to set `ulimit -n 1000000` in the shell before running `make run-metro`
- to add `ulimit -n 1000000` before all commands inside `scripts/start-react-native.sh` and start `make run-metro`

Neither of these worked
I purged Nix to install it using Rosetta Terminal (to see if it's working). Now, I'm stuck with the `permission denied` error (https://github.com/status-im/status-mobile/issues/16344). 😢

@smohamedjavid @mmilad75 @rasom @codemaster115 @vkjr, please share the following to help investigation:

1. `uname -s`
2. `sysctl kern.maxfiles`
3. `sysctl kern.maxfilesperproc`
4. `ulimit -n`
5. `lsof | wc -l`
6. `lsof -n | cut -f1 -d' ' | uniq -c | sort | tail -30`

@siddarthkay, @flexsurfer, what do you think of adding `node_modules` to `ignore_dirs` in `.watchmanconfig`? This might fix the issue and improve the overall performance as amount of files in this folder is huge.

We can try and see.

> what do you think of adding node_modules to ignore_dirs in .watchmanconfig

that fixes the issue for me locally

> what do you think of adding node_modules to ignore_dirs in .watchmanconfig

It works for me locally.

oh well, not really
then it goes
```
error: Error: Unable to resolve module node-libs-react-native/globals from /Users/romanvolosovskyi/clj/status-react/index.js: node-libs-react-native/globals could not be found within the project or in these directories:

> 1 | import 'node-libs-react-native/globals';
    |         ^
  2 | import './result/index.js';
  3 |
...
```

Adding `node_modules` to `ignore_dirs` didn't work for me:

To open developer menu press "d"

> I guess @smohamedjavid could try to git revert --no-commit c9755979 and see if that fixes it for him.

@rasom @vkjr @codemaster115 - can you help me try this?

i don't have any issues on macos 
```
[nix-shell:~/Dev/status-react]$ uname -s
Darwin

[nix-shell:~/Dev/status-react]$ sysctl kern.maxfiles
kern.maxfiles: 245760

[nix-shell:~/Dev/status-react]$ sysctl kern.maxfilesperproc
kern.maxfilesperproc: 122880

[nix-shell:~/Dev/status-react]$ ulimit -n
10240

[nix-shell:~/Dev/status-react]$ lsof | wc -l
132833

[nix-shell:~/Dev/status-react]$ lsof -n | cut -f1 -d' ' | uniq -c | sort | tail -30
 
 117835 watchman

```

@vkjr in your case `kern.maxfiles` and `kern.maxfilesperproc` are also smaller, than others have.
Try to change it too:
```
sudo sysctl -w kern.maxfiles=10485760
sudo sysctl -w kern.maxfilesperproc=1048576
```
@flexsurfer, you have increased settings and watchman opened 100k files.

> @flexsurfer, you have increased settings and watchman opened 100k files.

yeah probably i did this in the past, i remember something, @jakubgs suggested

> @rasom @vkjr @codemaster115 - can you help me try this?

@smohamedjavid, this did work!

That's weird, because `watchman` documentation suggests, that raiding the limits is not needed anymore on macOS 10.7 and up. Since they switched from `kqueue` to `fsevents`:https://facebook.github.io/watchman/docs/install.html#macos-file-descriptor-limits

https://github.com/status-im/status-mobile/blob/d91e67cae7fd85765389ab64b3ada202c815b771/nix/KNOWN_ISSUES.md?plain=1#L22
https://github.com/status-im/status-mobile/blob/d91e67cae7fd85765389ab64b3ada202c815b771/nix/KNOWN_ISSUES.md?plain=1#L76
is this related ? btw i also run `make nix-upgrade` today
